example.eg: I like to plant straight rows of daffodils.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢种植一排排整齐的水仙。

example.eg: We got tickets in the fifth row.
The children were sitting in rows at the front of the room.
example.egtrans: 那些孩子们在屋子前面坐成一排。

example.eg: They stopped being friends after their row over money.
example.egtrans: 因为钱的事吵架后，他们就不再是朋友了。

example.eg: The cox does not row the boat, but commands the crew.
example.egtrans: 舵手不划船，但是会向船员发号施令。

example.eg: You can sit at the bow while I row.
example.egtrans: 我划船时，你可以坐在船头。

example.eg: We live in a nice row, with a little garden.
example.egtrans: 我们住在一个不错的街道上，房子还带一个小花园。

trans_examp.trans_cn: （两边为住宅的）路, 街道, 街区

example.eg: The objective is to get to your opponent's back row.
example.egtrans: 目标就是将棋子跳进你对手的后排横格。

example.eg: The table has five rows of data.
We could hardly hear ourselves think for the frightful row blaring out of the neighbouring nightclub.
example.egtrans: 隔壁的夜总会爆发出的可怕喧闹声，我们几乎没办法静下来思考。

dsense.name: row
dsense.guideword: (knitting, crochet: line of stitches) (编织、钩编)

example.eg: This pattern alternates a row of knit stitches with a row of purl.
He rowed in the notable London Boat Race.
example.egtrans: 他参加了著名的伦敦划船比赛。

example.eg: They rowed about who would go first.
example.egtrans: 他们就谁先离开一事而发生争吵。

example.eg: The sailor rowed the prisoner to shore.
There was a bitter row between North Korea and South Korea.
Some of the most violent criminals of our time are sitting on death row.
They had a row about his staying out all night.
She arranged the toy soldiers all in a row.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 排成一排, 站成一排

example.eg: We have had temperatures of 34 degrees and above for five days in a row.
example.egtrans: 我们已经连续五天气温在34度以上了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 连续地, 接连地, 不间断地

dsense.name: row house (US), terraced house (UK), terrace house

example.eg: Large numbers of terraced houses are now standing empty.

dsense.name: skid row
dsense.guideword: US, slang, often capitalized (poor urban area) (俚语)

example.eg: If you carry on like that you'll end up on Skid Row in no time!
